articles.author: Gaming News
articles.description:
Take-Two and EA have quietly slipped AI warnings into their latest 10-K filings, flagging that using generative AI in game development could spark ‚Äúsocial and ethical issues,‚Äù lead to legal headaches and even erode fan trust. They‚Äôre doing it because public companies must list any material risk‚Äîfrom hurricanes to worker strikes‚Äîso investors know what could go sideways.
Industry watchers like Niko Partners‚Äô Daniel Ahmad point out that nearly every big studio (yes, even Nintendo) is experimenting with AI, mostly at the concept stage. Take-Two‚Äôs boss Strauss Zelnick says these tools will boost efficiency but never replace human creativity, while EA and Microsoft foresee short-term layoffs followed by long-term job growth. Both giants have recently cut hundreds of positions, though it‚Äôs unclear how much AI played a role.
articles.title: EA admits that embracing AI could lead to fans losing confidence in the company and its brands.

articles.author: AR/VR News
articles.description:
Meta‚Äôs cooking up a glasses-style AR/VR headset codenamed ‚ÄúLoma‚Äù (aka the rumored Puffin) and is reportedly wooing Disney and indie studio A24 for exclusive or timed-exclusive streaming rights. The gadget leans on a pocketable compute ‚Äúpuck,‚Äù aiming for a price point above the $300 Quest line but well below Apple‚Äôs $3,500 Vision Pro.
Andrew ‚ÄúBoz‚Äù Bosworth reminds everyone that Meta juggles tons of prototypes‚Äîsome never see daylight‚Äîso Loma/Puffin might shift or morph before launch. Still, snagging marquee content could give Meta serious bragging rights in its mixed-reality showdown with Apple.
articles.title: Meta's reportedly shopping for exclusive Disney and A24 content on its upcoming ultralight XR headset

articles.author: AI News
articles.description:
Steve Carell admits he‚Äôs genuinely spooked by AI‚Äîperfect, flawless art just doesn‚Äôt feel real to him, and he worries deepfakes and advanced tech could unleash chaos faster than we think. He‚Äôs front-and-center in Jesse Armstrong‚Äôs new HBO thriller, Mountainhead, which imagines a world run by tech billionaires where a major deepfake incident throws Asia into violent confusion.
Carell insists Mountainhead is even darker and crazier than Succession, comparing its tone to a modern-day Dr. Strangelove. Yet amid the bone-chilling scenarios, Jesse Armstrong weaves in razor-sharp humor‚Äîgiving us both a laugh and a terrifying glimpse of a not-so-distant tech-obsessed future.
articles.title: Steve Carell says he is worried about AI. Says his latest film "Mountainhead" is a society we might soon live in

Start fast. Build smart. Try BeB today!

articles.author: Sebastian Sch√ºrmann
articles.description:
I had a goal: to create a command-line interface (CLI) for a well-known API I was using at work. There wasn‚Äôt one available, and I saw an opportunity. The twist? I decided to write it with the help of a Large Language Model (LLM), using Python‚Äîa language that isn't exactly my mother tongue. The ultimate aim was to release it to the public on PyPI.
This is the story of my journey and the lessons I learned along the way.
My first major hurdle was finding a valid client generator for the OpenAPI spec provided by the API. I went down a rabbit hole trying to find a tool that could generate a set of reusable API client classes that would play nicely with my chosen Python dependency management flavoor. It was a frustrating and time-consuming process.
As the LLM and I churned out code, I decided t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Trying to get s*** done with an LLM

articles.author: Sajidur Rahman Shajib
articles.description:
When it comes to writing clean and maintainable code, the SOLID principles are essential tools every developer should know. But here‚Äôs the truth: it's not just about memorizing five fancy terms ‚Äî it's about recognizing when and how to apply them in real code. You don‚Äôt need to recite the definitions ‚Äî you need to practice them.



Letter
Principle Name
Abbreviation
Key Idea




S
Single Responsibility Principle
SRP
One class = One responsibility


O
Open/Closed Principle
OCP
Open to extension, closed to modification


L
Liskov Substitution Principle
LSP
Subtypes must be substitutable for base types


I
Interface Segregation Principle
ISP
No forcing of unused methods; favor small, focused interfaces


D
Dependency Inversion Principle
DIP
Depend on abstractions, not concrete implementations
‚Ä¶
articles.title: üèõÔ∏è 5 Pillars of SOLID

articles.author: Ikoh Sylva
articles.description:
This week started with a helpful revision session of the last class (summary here definitely worth a look if you missed it!). After that, we got into enhancing readability, guided by our excellent instructor. 

The transform property does not apply to inline elements in a flow layout, as these elements are designed to seamlessly flow with surrounding content. To enable transformations, you can change the element's display property to inline-block or use layout modes like Grid or Flexbox.
The transition property is a vital aspect of CSS animations, allowing for smooth transitions between states of an element. This reduces abrupt changes and enhances user experience by making interactions feel more fluid.
For example, consider two circles; when you hover over the red circle, it might scale u‚Ä¶
articles.title: AltSchool Of Engineering Tinyuka‚Äô24 Month 4 Week 2

articles.author: Augusts Bautra
articles.description:
Summer vibes are in the air. With Grug Brained Dev's book coming out and Uncle Bob discussing software design with John Ousterhout, I, too, am getting into a philosophical mood.

One problem I have been thinking about for the past several months is how to improve software maintainability, specifically, how to write code that makes common extension scenarios as simple as possible. Where's the space for new code to go?
As an aside, this is probably because at work I've been tasked with seemingly simple updates to existing old functionalities only to come up against very steep technical debt walls - Backbone JS views preclude simple field additions (never mind discovering what the controller -> json -> JS -> Backbone view event path is); existing exporters are such a tangled mess of branching‚Ä¶
articles.title: Resurgence of Software Design in 2025?
